intro: Lampranthus longisepalus, commonly known as the long-sepaled lampranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to orange, and bloom in late winter to early spring. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
